page.title: 03An Inhabitant of Stoulton
page.content: Mary, who is fifty-seven years old was born in Stoulton, and went to school there until she was seven years old. She met her husband in the village and they have two children, a boy and a girl, who are both married. One lives in Kempsey, the other in Worcester, both of them were christened and married in Stoulton like herself. She has four grandchildren, two boys and two girls. Mary used to belong to the Womens Institute, but she was unable to be a regular member after her father became bedridden. He was well-known among the villagers for his prize-winning vegetables and died aged eighty-seven. Mary lives in a council house opposite what used to be the local smithy and she feels there has been little change in Stoulton over the years.
